title: Applied Statistics for the Life Sciences
description: Data collection and experimental design, descriptive statistics, confidence intervals, parametric and non parametric one and two-sample hypothesis tests, analysis of variance, correlation, simple linear regression, chi-square tests, relative risk and odds. Applications of statistics to the life sciences. Substantial use of statistical software. Not open to students with credit in STAT 217 or STAT 251. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE B1.
prerequisites: Passing score on the ELM examination, or an ELM exemption, or credit in MATH 104
